lead_id: # lead_id: Unique identifier for each lead (string)
# inquiry_date: Date when customer first contacted you (YYYY-MM-DD)
# destination: Where they want to travel (Latin America
# trip_price: Total cost of the trip in dollars (number)
# quote_date: Date you sent them a quote (YYYY-MM-DD or blank if not sent)
# booking_date: Date they paid deposit/booked (YYYY-MM-DD or blank if not booked)
# trip_date: Date of actual trip (YYYY-MM-DD or blank if not booked)
# final_payment_date: Date final payment was made (YYYY-MM-DD or blank)
# duration_days: Length of trip in days (number)
# 1. Dates must be in YYYY-MM-DD format
# 2. Leave date fields blank (empty) if that stage hasn't occurred yet

inquiry_date: only inquiry_date and quote_date (if sent) should have values
fill in dates up to current stage only

lead_id: # 5. trip_price should be 0 for lost/cancelled leads
# 6. Current stage values must match exactly: inquiry
# 7. You need at least 2 years of historical data for accurate forecasting

inquiry_date: even ones that didn't convert - this helps train the model
